nodes.bodyText: Should we just provide those classes in trino-hive-apache as shims that delegate to Airlift implementations instead?

That would cause classpath conflicts for anyone adding the compression codecs to the plugin classpath.
@electrum do you have an opinion?

conflicts for anyone adding the compression codecs to the plugin classpath.

We usually do not support hacking, don't we?

we would need to have some transition period,

Does it mean we encourage users to place jars manually somewhere?

Does it mean we encourage users to place jars manually somewhere?

i do not. but was trying to be empathetic if they do
I agree, while this is clever, shims would be cleaner. I’m not concerned with breaking anyone who added additional JARs. This will be better for them anyway as they won’t need to do it anymore.

+package com.hadoop.compression.lzo;
+
+//  Certain file formats store codec class name within file header section
+//  (e.g. sequence file) and provide no clean way for providing custom codec
+//  factory.
+public class LzoCodec
